labels.name: A: In progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > When scrolling down or up the feed on Facebook mobile page (m.facebook.com), at some point when you have scrolled enough, posts start "jumping". > > In practice, I get scrolled back to previous post. This doesn't happen on each post, but at some point it starts to happen quite frequently. > > This can't be presented via screenshots, but in those screenshots I've already scrolled past the post that has a blonde woman on it and the fishing post is now appearing. From that point, when I scroll forward, I get thrown back so that the fishing post disappears and I see the post that was before the post with a blonde woman. > > Looking at the DOM at the same time when scrolling and this issue appears, I see that an ad post that was hid earlier, gets its "displayed" class removed from it. And if I scroll to the other direction, it gets added back (and I jump back to my previous location at the feed). I think that Facebook still manipulates those already hidden ad elements, which causes me to jump into wrong place at the Feed. > > If I remove those hidden ad posts (the whole node) this issue doesn't appear. > > "displayed" class already gets removed and added back to regular posts when scrolling up and down but that doesn't cause issues. Only when that class is removed or added back to an already hidden ad element. Username: `@peace2000` ### Screenshots

This doesn't happen on each post, but at some point it starts to happen quite frequently. > > This can't be presented via screenshots, but in those screenshots I've already scrolled past the post that has a blonde woman on it and the fishing post is now appearing. From that point, when I scroll forward, I get thrown back so that the fishing post disappears and I see the post that was before the post with a blonde woman. > > Looking at the DOM at the same time when scrolling and this issue appears, I see that an ad post that was hid earlier, gets its "displayed" class removed from it. I think that Facebook still manipulates those already hidden ad elements, which causes me to jump into wrong place at the Feed. > > If I remove those hidden ad posts (the whole node) this issue doesn't appear. > > "displayed" class already gets removed and added back to regular posts when scrolling up and down but that doesn't cause issues. issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > When scrolling down or up the feed on Facebook mobile page (m.facebook.com), at some point when you have scrolled enough, posts start "jumping". > > In practice, I get scrolled back to previous post. This doesn't happen on each post, but at some point it starts to happen quite frequently. > > This can't be presented via screenshots, but in those screenshots I've already scrolled past the post that has a blonde woman on it and the fishing post is now appearing. From that point, when I scroll forward, I get thrown back so that the fishing post disappears and I see the post that was before the post with a blonde woman. > > Looking at the DOM at the same time when scrolling and this issue appears, I see that an ad post that was hid earlier, gets its "displayed" class removed from it. And if I scroll to the other direction, it gets added back (and I jump back to my previous location at the feed). I think that Facebook still manipulates those already hidden ad elements, which causes me to jump into wrong place at the Feed. > > If I remove those hidden ad posts (the whole node) this issue doesn't appear. > > "displayed" class already gets removed and added back to regular posts when scrolling up and down but that doesn't cause issues. Only when that class is removed or added back to an already hidden ad element. Username: `@peace2000` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/4h8rhrz5xl6oo040gkssc8ckgkgkgkoyxmtckwwz7k.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > When scrolling down or up the feed on Facebook mobile page (m.facebook.com), at some point when you have scrolled enough, posts start "jumping". > > In practice, I get scrolled back to previous post. This doesn't happen on each post, but at some point it starts to happen quite frequently. > > This can't be presented via screenshots, but in those screenshots I've already scrolled past the post that has a blonde woman on it and the fishing post is now appearing. From that point, when I scroll forward, I get thrown back so that the fishing post disappears and I see the post that was before the post with a blonde woman. > > Looking at the DOM at the same time when scrolling and this issue appears, I see that an ad post that was hid earlier, gets its "displayed" class removed from it. And if I scroll to the other direction, it gets added back (and I jump back to my previous location at the feed). I think that Facebook still manipulates those already hidden ad elements, which causes me to jump into wrong place at the Feed. > > If I remove those hidden ad posts (the whole node) this issue doesn't appear. > > "displayed" class already gets removed and added back to regular posts when scrolling up and down but that doesn't cause issues. Only when that class is removed or added back to an already hidden ad element. Username: `@peace2000` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to leave only these filters, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
```
AdGuard Base
AdGuard Mobile Ads
AdGuard Tracking Protection
AdGuard Social Media
AdGuard Cookie Notices
AdGuard Popups
AdGuard Mobile App Banners
AdGuard Other Annoyances
AdGuard Widgets
AdGuard German
```

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: Cleanup duplicate rules in GermanFilter (specific.txt)

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There are multiple duplicate rules in the filters.

- [ ] ###fh-inside-bottom 
- [ ] ###leaderboard 
- [ ] ###superbanner 
- [ ] ##.Ad-Slot 
- [ ] ##.a-article-teaser--sponsored 
- [ ] ##.ad-container 
- [ ] ##.alice-adslot 
- [ ] ##.bannerslot-centered 
- [ ] ##.va-sponsored 
- [ ] ##a[href*="/E-Commerce-Thema-"] 
- [ ] ##a[rel*="sponsored"] 
- [ ] ##body .adAnything:not(#style_important) 
- [ ] ##div[data-ads-slot] 
- [ ] ##div[data-role="sidebarAd"] 
- [ ] ##div[data-testid="display-ad"] 
- [ ] ##div[id^="CAD"] 
- [ ] ##div[id^="ad-"] 
- [ ] ##div[id^="div-gpt-ad"] 
- [ ] ##div[id^="traffective-ad-"]  
- [ ] ||widgets.outbrain.com^$domain=
- [ ] ||img.ui-portal.de/container/generic_
- [ ] ||widgets.outbrain.com/outbrain.js$domain= 
 
```
nydus.org###fplayer + div > div[id^="nbn"]
nydus.org#?##fplayer + div > div[id^="nbn"]
```
```
nydus.org###fplayer + div[id^="nbn"]
nydus.org#?##fplayer + div[id^="nbn"]
```
```
nydus.org###fplayer > div[id^="nbn"]
nydus.org#?##fplayer > div[id^="nbn"]
```
```
nydus.org###lsky
nydus.org#?##lsky
```
```
nydus.org###r600sky
nydus.org#?##r600sky
```
```
blick.ch##aside[class*="placement-"]
blick.ch#?#aside[class*="placement-"]
```
```
weltwoche.ch,sky.de##div[id^="werbung"]
weltwoche.ch##div[class^="werbung"]

weltwoche.de##div[id^="werbung"]
weltwoche.de##div[class^="werbung"]
```


 

### Proposed solution

Merge or remove rules if possible.



### Additional information

_No response_

pull_request.title: Fix AdGuardTeam#207788 tiermaker.com
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

This update removes the anti-adblocker popup on TierMaker, restoring full access to the site for users with AdGuard enabled.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [x] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

### Enter the issue address

This one : <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207788>

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Your comment

The filter I added targets the div with the class "fEy1Z2XT" which corresponds to the anti-adblocker popup on TierMaker and removes its display. As a result, the website becomes fully functional even with an AdGuard enabled.

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1 (before):</summary>

![Capture d'écran 2025-06-18 203218](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/24e7c3ea-93cd-4639-819e-1bcc9d4a1771)

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 2 (after):</summary>

![Capture d'écran 2025-06-18 205725](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aa5aebff-6d77-452e-ab36-6b4e97858cab)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://tiermaker.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftiermaker.com%2F) ### Comment > AdGuard’s ad‑blocking filters are being detected by TierMaker, triggering a full‑screen popup (implemented as a div with the ID "fEy1Z2XT") that completely blocks access to the site until AdGuard is disabled or TierMaker is whitelisted. Additionally, the volume and intrusiveness of advertisements on TierMaker are highly disruptive. Ads continuously interrupt the user experience. Username: `@Lea-Bar` ### Screenshots
